model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I just visited Italy recently, it was much better than I had first anticipated, similar to Alaska with all the landscapes and scenery! Now I'm planning to go to Japan, do you have any recommendations on what to do there?

MEMORY:
1. Speaker A wishes to visit the country where origami was originally created, possibly Japan.
2. Speaker B was recommended volunteering by Speaker A and has traveled to Japan and Italy, enjoying the art and food.
3. Speaker B has visited Japan and found it to be an amazing country.
4. Speaker A met someone at the hospital who visited Italy and enjoyed the art museums and restaurants there.
5. Speaker A plans to visit Italy first before going to Japan.
6. Speaker A offered to teach Speaker B origami in a few weeks.
current_dialogue: Speaker A: I just visited Italy recently, it was much better than I had first anticipated, similar to Alaska with all the landscapes and scenery! Now I'm planning to go to Japan, do you have any recommendations on what to do there?

speaker: Parent
raw_prediction: Oh, Italy must have been an incredible experience! In Japan, you should definitely visit the historic temples in Kyoto, explore the bustling streets of Tokyo, and immerse yourself in the rich culture by trying traditional tea ceremonies and enjoying the delicious local cuisine. Don't forget to visit some of the beautiful gardens and maybe even attend a traditional Japanese performance. You're going to have an amazing time there!
